intro: Saracha acutifolia, commonly known as the sharp-leaved saracha, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Saracha acutifolia is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. It is valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
